This movie wasn't created for the fans of The Haunted Castle or fans of H.P. Lovercraft's Reanimator. This movies sort of reminds of the the Ring with no story. The stuff just happens in his movie. There wasn't any time to waste in this film, The Bye Bye Man had an agenda, he was busy scaring the heck out of people. And due to to this, there isn't much of a story and for me that was awesome. This movie is 100% shock value, not bore value. The CG was good and so was the acting. I don't know why people expect Tom Cruse to be in every horror movie, it's not going to happen.If you need a good scare I highly recommend this film. It's much better than crappy Sinister 2 and the Rings.

reviews.review_title: Think it, say it, but don't watch it
reviews.content: Stupidest horror movie that i have ever seen, and i saw blair witch 2, and all of the friday the 13th movies, everything is so poorly acted and poorly written than it just comes of as stupid, the bye bye man is the stupidest name that i have ever scene, stupid stupid stupid

The Bye Bye Man takes a somewhat clever premise, and tramples it in the mud by clumsily mashing together elements from superior horror flicks, adding up to a derivative effort as short on originality as coherency and making anyone believe it's a horror film, rather than a bland, scare-less venture into how not to make horror.

A young college couple and his best friend rent an enormous house. Turns out there is a bogeyman called the Bye Bye Man and, once you speak or even think his name, he will turn up with his huge bad-CGI dog and mess with your head and people will die. The trick is to kill them and yourself before anyone else learns his name. Or before they write it on a piece of furniture in the house you're renting.Candyman did this, of course, years ago, with minor differences. No mirrors are involved here, and you only have to think the name, which explains people endlessly saying "Don't think it, don't say it" and endlessly writing same on walls, furniture, curtains etc. Though this doesn't explain writing the name in full on the bottom of a shelf first and then not crossing it out.So remember, kids, don't just throw that nightstand into the woods, make sure you burn it first.The three youngsters are all fine, and are mostly believable as they try to find a way to thwart the hooded Bye Bye Man and his flayed-bulldog-looking pet, which gnaws contentedly on the corpses of your friends after you've killed them.In truth, the Bye Bye Man's modus operandum is lacking a few bits of essential explanation - does he actually kill you? Or just fool you into killing others? Do you only kill people who have heard his name? - and also has some illogicality about it - if everyone gets killed then how is his name going to be disseminated so that he will have other to kill? He needs a bit more mythology in place before he makes his second outing, methinks,My comments might be somewhat disparaging, but this film succeeds fairly well, albeit it draws heavily on Candyman and the more recent It Follows in creating the same sort of dread. The idea of a horrible but unavoidable fate which follows inexorably gives you immense sympathy for the protagonists: you hope they find a solution. The fact that it happens once you have innocently stepped over a line which you didn't even know was there means that you howl at the unfairness of it.Faye Dunaway cameos: I wondered who it was. She sends a message: stay away from Botox.
Don't waste your time, it's just awful, terrible, bad movie. The acting was bad, plot was bad, everything was bad.

The movie was pretty good. Had some good jump scares. The storyline was awesome. The only problem I had was the girl that played Sasha couldn't act her way out of a wet paper sack. The only time her acting wears spot on was when she was waking up. Most actors have a difficult time making that look real. This girl made it look convincing that she had just woke up. But that is really sad that this is the only time her acting was good in the entire movie.

As a horror movie fan, I'm very picky when it comes to horror movies. During the whole time the movie was playing I was thinking to myself "With better actors and better cinematography, this movie was going to be a hit." Unfortunately, it wasn't, but that is not to say it was terrible. The idea was neat. Not revolutionary if you have seen the Boogie Man movies. While Boogie Man had much better cinematography, for some odd reason I found The Bye Bye Man to be much less boring. It could be because of the mediocre acting that made me role my eyes once in a while. The lead actor was not bad, but the girl and the black guy went on my nerves. The story was good. The cinematography and acting were mediocre. The story kept my attention and I managed to sit through the whole thing and not regret watching it. What sent chills down my spine was not the jump scares (which didn't even work for me) but the one thing the lead actor told the female police officer "You really think the truth, honesty is the best policy?" and also when I was asking myself whether or not the little girl was going to say the name of the Bye Bye Man and start the cycle all over again. The twist at the end of the movie was rather good. I honestly didn't see that coming. I think this is worth watching once and it was better and less boring than some horror titles I've seen recently, even though the title of the movie might suggest that it's going to be garbage, which it isn't. At least, not entirely.5/10

The absolute best scene is when the fat black librarian lady, Ms. Watkins (the absolute worst actor in the film), is somehow "possessed" by the bye bye man, kills her whole family offscreen, walks like a zombie with Down's Syndrome into the middle of a random mountain road, and gets bulldozed by the main characters' truck at like 80 mph and cartoonishly flips through the air. LOLOne of the least scariest and least adept films I've ever seen in my life, almost seems like a major budget film made with the skill and care of pretentious college kids with cringe ideas and next to no talent. Absolutely dumbfounding to see so many positive reviews on this abomination. It's literally only entertaining in it's complete and utter incompetence on every level I can think of.

Come on people, a 4.2 rating is for the wretched hand-held, badly shot straight to video, Blair Witch ripoffs produced by Ed Wood wannabes that clog up the Netflix Horror category. This is an above average movie that is well directed and has good actors. The cinematography was nicely done, as well. Although seeing Faye Dunaway, a long time crush, the way she looks now, was more horrifying than most of the film. The main bad guy (I'm not saying his name) was shown in too much light to be an effective boogie man and the computer generated dog should have been left out. Given all it flaws though, it's a nicely produced movie that isn't a 'mockumentary' and was an entertaining, not too demanding Horror romp. Always love seeing Carrie-Ann Moss, too.

reviews.review_title: That girl... confirming the casting couch rumer
reviews.content:
She blew more than the rating to get that part. Am I right director? Am I right?
Because there is no way, they looked at the 5 finalists or whatever for that part and decided she was the best.
As for the movie. Had good elements; lighting, couple decent actors for being Green (non of the leads), couple ideas that were somewhat thrilling.
But this film was made for teens to make out on a couch to, and about halfway through the film the creators embrace that and check out too cause they know their audience just needs background noise.
But that girl. I can't say enough for how terrible her performance was.

This movie is atrocious! In 2017, we still get piling lumps of crap like this. I wish I had never watched this and wasted my time. I CANNOT BELIEVE this is a movie. The plot is horrible and really doesn't give you any cause for interest. The acting is quite possibly some of the worst i have ever seen. The "bye-bye man" is not even remotely scary.I will never get my time back.

reviews.review_title: The acting in this film was "4am TV" kind of acting
reviews.content: This film is why people hate horror today. The acting in this film is shockingly bad. Reactions to such things that would take you back, were like they already had seen it to not be that shocked.The make up and design of the bye bye man, it was like a decently made Halloween costume you'd do at home than a horror film. The cgi in some scenes... yep. Douglas smith as Elliot was probably the worst actor, especially one certain scene.There's a shot gun scene, two people shot, zero blood, or even good acting as the victims were shot. It looked more like improv class, and the act was drop like you've been shot by a shotgun.The entire "don't think it don't say it" and he won't get you is like don't think or dreamnor Freddy Kruger and he can't kill you. Kim's big scene (you'll see it when it happens) sort of made me giggle! It was like a genuine comedy scene and I did that tired slow laugh at it.If I was to give positives, I'd say, there was about one or two scenes that were good acting.

reviews.review_title: Not That Bad Supernatural Horror Flick!
reviews.content:
This 2017 horror film tell of young man, Elliot (Douglas Smith) who moves into a new house with his girlfriend, Sasha (Cressida Bonas) and best friend, John (Lucien Laviscount). Soon, strange things happen and Elliot finds himself in a nightmare when he learns of evil spirit, The Bye Bye Man (Doug Jones) that causes hallucinations and violent acts involving them and others that say his name. This isn't that bad, except for some of the acting, but there's shocking and suspenseful moments plus an eerie score.
Horror fans may want to check this out at least once.

This has got to be one of the laziest horror movies i've seen recently. I tried watching it with an open mind, i've heard how bad it supposedly was, but i was willing to give it a chance. Five minutes into the movie i was very confused; it looks like a parody, the concept is very silly but they took it way too seriously and it was poorly, poorly executed.I think the story made no sense whatsoever, they set up this urban legened-type character, but they gave him no backstory and no real purpose. You say his name, he comes for you, but he doesn't kill you, he just... makes you see things? And you kill yourself? And what's with the coins and the train? And the awful CGI dog? I believe the filmakers wanted to start this urban legend where people would spread their theories around the internet and such, but they fail to make it interesting or scary enough.Also the acting is embarrasing, the editing is amateurish and the directing feels rushed and sloppy, like the director wanted to make this as quickly as possible and the editor tried to make a coherent product but he also failed.But i would be lying if say i didn't have a good time, it's an interesting experience, it's kinda amusing to watch and be constantly asking yourself if they were serious about the decisions the makers of the movie made. I guess it's one of those " see it to believe it" kind of movies.

reviews.review_title: A bland forgettable nothing of a movie
reviews.content: Well for a start it's got one of the worst titles you could ever give to what's supposed to be a serious horror movie, "The Bye Bye Man" is a title a baby would utter, it's that stupid song Nsync brought out where they're all puppets! For whoever cares it's about these college students moving into an old abandoned house where they stumble upon the spooky legend of the Bye Bye Man, that I think does something like manipulates people's minds until they walk into their own deaths, a bit like Final Destination. What can be said about this inept movie is that it's almost as friggin silly as it's title is, a lot of it is just repetitive going back and forth crap in regards to the daft rules of the Man, but in the end that doesn't mean very much when you've got an overall experience that's as unremarkable as this one is. It runs for the standard hour and a half but my goodness it felt like a chore to sit through, it's nonsensical, poorly acted, especially from the main girl who's putting on an American accent but she can't keep it together for damn one minute because she's so obviously British. That's a little funny at times but it's not enough to make it a passable movie at all. There's terrible cgi effects and wasted acting opportunities from people who I like and know can act like Faye Dunaway and even the wonderful Doug Jones seems to not really be giving his monstery all here, the movie is a mess that is so very forgettable I'm pretty sure I was forgetting it while I was still watching it the one time only that I did, super-unmemorable and just very dull and weak. Don't bother, who ever would want too lol, films like this are highly produced chaff, I frequently watch dirt cheap indie horror movies with tons more charm and enjoyably to them. Not good! "What d'ya think I am, a flashlight?" x.

I really don,t know what some of these reviewers are talking about ,i thought this horror movie was half decent.My only gripe was that they didn't show enough of the Bye Bye man and have him do a whole bunch of crazy psychotic stuff.I liked the concept and the acting wasn't half bad at all i,v seen worse.What are these reviewers talking about? Maybe they should get of their butts and make a better movie.

reviews.review_title: I'm pretending this movie doesn't exist
reviews.content: This movie is GOD AWFUL!!! Slow pace, bad script, and an empty story. Even Rings (2017) was better even though I like that one. This movie is so not scary in every single way like there's a "jump scare" (I use the word loosely because it's actually cheap). Just watch A Nightmare on Elm Street, Friday The 13th, Halloween, and Texas Chainsaw Massacre instead because they're actually fun to watch. Don't say it, Don't watch this movie.

Not really worth watching. While the actors weren't bad, necessarily, they definitely lacked the range needed for such horrific circumstances. I was surprised to see famous actors playing small supporting parts in a movie this bad. I guess Faye Dunaway and Carrie-Anne Moss need to take the work when they can get it. I think the biggest culprit was the writing. (SPOILER) The contrived ways they used to get people to say "bye Bye Man" were pretty lame.

reviews.review_title: Don't think it, don't say it
reviews.content: This was a obviously bad horror movie. This was apparently based off a book called "the bridge to body island", so I did some research on it and the book was more interesting than the movie.The acting was laughable and the characters were really dumb, the actors weren't giving that much of a performance and weren't given good dialogue.It wasn't that scary and at times the effects were weird looking and funny in how they were used, there were also false scares or bad jumpscares.A lot of situations either didn't make sense or didn't need to happen, also characters that didn't need to be in this like Carrie-Anne Moss and Faye Dunaway.The only thing I can say is that I liked the plot and concept of the Bye Bye Man also Doug Jones playing the Bye Bye Man, I thought the slow movements of the character were played well by him.But other than that, this is a laughably bad movie that felt like a student film and was not scary.

reviews.review_title: If horror movies this days got out of horror topics so this is an insult to horror movies
reviews.content: When i first saw the trailer i said it's a must watch but i saw it yesterday,now lets start the presence of characters literally zero,bad plot bad acting even the bye bye man himself he would have made the movie good but unfortunately because the acting of surrounding people got him in the legs and him bad eve Jacob trembley's sister was in it that was one of the reasons i was so excited the screenplay was shitty really shitty so as directing,they have to make a sequel to make a good movie like they did with Ouija i wanted to love it but no this 2 grades just for jump scares a bad shitty plot bad makeup good costumes and decoration the problem with the screenplay is that it left big Questions left and silly things and i wont forget the bad silly acting of every single person in this i wanted to adore it but sorry i can't Lie and Say its good or not bad

reviews.review_title: Bad film with some interesting scenes.
reviews.content: The Bye Bye Man is a bad film, very weak. The characters are silly and the script is a flop, there is two decent scenes. The cinematography is specially awful. The 2010's brought good horror films and of course bad films too, The Bye Bye Man is in this section. Nothing more to say about this film.

Where do I begin? Put it this way, I watched The Cabinet Of Dr Caligari earlier that day, which was regarded as the first real horror film, and it was ten times better than this abomination. Script, acting, plot, costume, music and most importantly the ability to create fear were all terrible. The most I jumped was when a door slammed, and that was only because of the loud noise. I'm sorry to break it to the director. But loud noises do not make a horror film. There so many plot holes, like the train. I still have no idea why there was a reoccurring train. Also how did the bye bye man came to be? Did he just pop up one day out of nowhere? What was the significance of the coins?Some of the acting literally had me laugh out loud. The editing did not help with that either. Honestly, if you're looking for a comedy to watch, i may have just found it.So in conclusion, if you want to keep your faith in good movies, do not watch this one. It will scar you for life. It is easily the worst film have ever watched. And I have seen a short film about a guy taking a piece of paper out of a back pack.Peace ✌️

reviews.review_title: How can you people give this an 8??!!
reviews.content: First: acting was like they didn't mean a word of what they were saying and all those meaningless sayings about eachother just to argu and actually say nothing in the end. Wtf is that creature? Just a scary thing and thats it? Gave a 2 because some things were funny.

reviews.review_title: OK premise but VERY poorly acted and executed
reviews.content: I'm at a point with horror movies that I go in hoping for the best but expecting the worst. It really has been about 1 out of every 6 or 7 that turns out to be pretty good. This was not one of them.So you already know what the flimsy story line is, so I will just comment on it. There is no explanation of what this entity, or his very poorly computer generated demon dog, is or how they came to be. The guy himself does have a certain air of menace but he doesn't really do much. The acting of just about everyone is sub-high school play. I mean really, did they pick up these people at Walmart, give them $20 and ask them to be in a movie? In all fairness, the movie did have some OK moments they would have been better with better actors and perhaps a director who took some time to flesh out the story. It just seemed almost like random events tied together by this very silly named entity. And I got really tired of the heavily repeated "Don't think it, don't say it" nonsense. I did like the cameo by Faye Dunaway and was surprised she was in this sub-par cinema, but she is in her sunset years so a little frivolous role is acceptable.And when the anti-climactic ending came and the credits started, I then saw why this may have been a crock. 'Screenplay by Jonathan Penner'. Really, the guy who was a Survivor contestant? I thought that was him earlier in the movie, he has a very distinctive voice. But I guess if you appear on Survivor you can suddenly be a screenwriter. But then I see his occasional credits extend before Survivor, though I don't recall that ever coming up during his time on that show.And sure, the movie did well at the box office opening weekend, but it's only because they played their cards right. It opened on Friday the 13th and there really weren't any other scary movies out there. So hooray for them for good game play but I expect this will drop like a stone during subsequent weekends. The movie may be OK for younger kids (and trust me, there were lots of obnoxious little monsters in the theater we were in who wouldn't shut up) who don't necessarily need a story line to follow and just like a modest jump now and then, but for anyone looking for an ounce of substance, look elsewhere. I'm shocked this was not a direct-to-video release.
Complete trash. Stupid. Bad actors. Dumb plot. Horrible script. No redeemable value whatsoever. Should have never been made. Utter rubbish.

On opening night, my sister was looking forward to seeing this title with her friend. Unfortunately she had to refuse last minute due to family stuff, so instead, my sis asked me to go with her. I had never been a fan of horror movies before but she showed me the trailer and i was interested. It wasn't anything special, but it made the movie look interesting, creepy atmosphere, creepy visuals, and the creepy view of one of the lead characters eyes rolling back in his head as he seemed to be possessed (which was a lie and never occurred in the movie). We sat in the theater and the movie began. Almost immediately I noticed how horrific the acting and the way they presented the "spooky" atmosphere was. After spending far too long getting to know everyone and why they are in the movie, the "scary" bit began. I say scary very loosely as throughout the movie, I felt no sense of fear or tension. Most of the scares that I noticed were jump scares meant to get a cheap reaction out of you. There was only one jump that was at least a little creative, involving a character who wakes up after seeing "the bye bye man" and it catches you off guard because it takes A few seconds too long to actually jump, putting you off guard. Other than that however, there was nothing that scared me in a "real" way. The ending stunk as it acted as if it felt like the movie to this point was a joke. It uses cheap excuses to kill off characters and people don't follow normal human behavior. Over all it was a miserable experience and would not recommend.

What I mean is, I like unrealistic horror (Poltergeist, The Ring, etc). I don't want to be disturbed, just frightened. And this movie hits that spot perfectly.Yes, *some* of the acting is poor, but it doesn't really harm the experience.Very happy with this film.

reviews.review_title: The main character ruined the film
reviews.content: This younger dude ruined it all. Cool story, but very bad acting.
This movie ties with the Nun in my worst movies ever made list. Like the Nun, almost unwatchable, with too many cliches and stupid jump scares to count.

reviews.review_title: Don't Think It, Don't Say It, Don't Even Watch This!
reviews.content: While we have gotten decent amount of good horror movies in 2017 such as It and Get Out, we also gotten some laughably bad ones. With the case of this movie, from Wish Upon to Snowman, this was definitely the worst one of the year. The Bye Bye Man is horrible as in completely unappealing and even un-scary. Some may say this is one of those horror movies that are hilariously bad, but the real problem is it failed at even being that. This would contain some of the most terribly written stories to ever be made for a horror film. The story is absolutely hopeless that it makes the film anything but interesting. Both the acting and the characters are a bunch of ego lunatics. The visuals look laughably terrible. And the scares and horrors that are nothing but jump scares. The most movie would do just for the scares is you see a character seeing things and you see the three to five seconds of imagery. Not to mention with the horrible ending since let us just say that we knew that moment would be coming since the beginning of it. This is one of those horror movies that I recommend you avoid unless if you want to see an example now a horror movie can be produced into a complete train wreck. I think I'll end this by saying this movie is absolutely nothing worth thinking or saying.

I really have no idea why so many people have rated this movie so negatively. I thought it was pretty good. I am a horror fan, and I have often been disappointed by the lack of intensity in some recent horror films. I thought this movie built and really went there. Some of the acting was either wooden or over the top, but I wasn't expecting Meryl Streep. It had me engaged and curious throughout, and I really thought the film was a lot of fun.

Corny movie. Bad acting. Bad Casting. It was like the boogie man as long as you're not scared of the monster. The movie made no sense. Nothing about it made sense. The budget of this movie did not match how the movie looked. Elliot was the non-believer that ended up becoming a believer. John and the girl never ended up having sex it was a waste of sexual tension
I tried watching this movie.. there was nothing scary or even interesting about it and with bad acting made it worse.. didn't even watch the first half an hour.

I'm serious when i say this: I made an IMDb account just to rebuttle the bad reviews. if you are considering watching this i say GO FOR IT. When i watched this i went into it wishing i was watching family guy, The horror is not great but the twist and plot keep me guessing and always wondering what we will uncover next, this movie should've been marketed as a mystery more then horror but it truly is not bad. Truly not bad

reviews.review_title: Not bad, but also not great
reviews.content: This has potential to be a good horror movie. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, and has a couple of jump scares, but the "monster" of this movie is not very well thought out and is disappointing. He's creepy though!

reviews.review_title: One of the Top 3 Worst Films Ever Made
reviews.content: 2nd worst movie I've ever seen.Goes nowhere.Bad acting.Bad writing.Too dark and depressing, and vague.Bad directing. Bad CGI. Waste of time and money. Horrible waste of your time and mind.

This was a good horror/thriller about 3 friends who move into a rental house with a dark history. As many strange things happen to the trio, they investigate the legacy of the former occupants and try to escape the Bye Bye man.

I remember seeing this in theaters with my at the time fiancé, skanky azz Hoe now. But thats a different horror movie all together. But anyways, I like this movie and watching it again it has originality to it. Its at least a 6.8-7.5

reviews.review_title: Way too many bad reviews for an Awesome movie!
reviews.content: I hate to say this but I hate PG-13 movies like a passion, but this took me by surprise. I was like slow at first and then woah, it is better than people are saying. I hate people that just because they do not like it, it is the worst movie ever, and not to everyone because of it. People like this are just out of their minds trying to persuade others to not take their own opinions and watching it themselves to find out if it good or not.Yes, as I have said it starts kind of slow, but once it kicks in, it is very fast paced and good. One of the best PG-13 horror movies. I did not notice the F words that IMDb says it contains in the PG-13 version. I never saw the unrated one. I think they messed it up saying that the PG-13 has 6 F-words in it. I think it is the unrated one has it, and saying that makes me want to buy the unrated one on Blu-Ray.Don't Think It, Don't Say It! Over and over again. Kind of like Candy Man movie, without saying it three or five times to bring the horror. I am the horror buff that loves R and Unrated over PG-13 but this has to one PG-13 movie I would watch if they put it on television. I would buy the Blu-Ray unrated in a heartbeat when I have the money. The bad reviews are just bad people that don't what hit them.I can't stand people that give good movies a bad rap. They need the bad rap about their stupid reviews. So, do not listen to the crap reviews and listen to our great reviews.

reviews.review_title: I dont get the bad reviews! I found it very enjoyable
reviews.content: I watched this multiple times, I enjoyed it every time. It's not like the most amazing movie, it's not going to win an Oscar or anything. But it's a good watch. It's enjoyable. It's a decent story, a decent cast and a decent story. I really enjoyed it. It's worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: The bye bye man along with slender man, are way too hated by carbon copy smug elitists. They're decent gateway horrors with some creepy yet cliche imagery.
reviews.content:
As it stands in my nearly 3 decades of being a horror fan I can't remember 2 films getting more flack and pretentious hatred than the bye-bye man and slender man. I mean yes I know that they are chock-full of clichés and complete cash grabs aimed at teens, but the amount of bashing I've read about them is just almost scary in itself because the critique has no logical merit. As it stands they both have ratings near 3/4 out of 10 on IMDb. They're at least somewhat creepy with certain bits of ominous imagery and I would honestly consider them middle of the road to decent gateway horror films. I would definitely at least give them a lower 6 out of 10. And the critique for both films is never in depth or logical. All I ever see is "garbage trash dumpster fire not scary" almost in carbon copy fashion. I mean at least if you're going to rip something apart and call
It the worst thing of all time give me some actual plausible reasons to believe your extreme statement. I think this generation is suffering from a huge problem with extreme love or hate opinions and just overall behavior in general. All I know is that I would rather watch the bye-bye man or slender man over a pseudo-intellectual artsy ineffective convoluted mess that is a24 horror. Films like hereditary the witch it comes at night that I don't even consider true horror but more of dull slow scam dramas. At least with the bye-bye man or slender man you get certain shades of actual horror-based material no matter how cliché it is.

I cannot imagine that any of these actors are ever offered work again after they did this film. This is one of those films where it says "movie budget = $500K" and they don't come close to breaking even. Rotten Tomatoes is going to have to allow for negative numbers so people can rank this honestly.
Don't urinate it. Don't defecate it. Or just do both. He's gonna kill you anyway.

reviews.review_title: Surprisingly bad (if you have low expectations, you should lower them)
reviews.content: I went into this January-release horror film expecting to be disappointed, but I had no idea that this was going to be so awful. The Bye Bye Man managed to be undeniably unscary. This movie is not scary to a degree I have never seen in a horror movie of this style. The jump scares will not make you jump, the pacing is poor, the acting is flat and completely unbelievable, the plot is vague and filled with loose ends and holes. What are the coins? The train? The weird demon dog? Why is the Bye Bye Man so completely not scary looking?The reveals are unsurprising. The acting is atrocious, and the character relationships feel thin and forced. The entire plot line with the librarian is unnecessary, and drags down the film in an almost tangible way. There is so much wrong with this film that I am actually baffled. I don't know how they managed to make this film feel so bland without it being intentional.It's been a long time since I've had such a bland horror experience in theaters. The most exciting part of the movie was the previews for things that will surely be better than this was. Save your movie money and skip this one, even if you're like me and go see every horror movie you can in theaters. This one is not worth the $8.

reviews.review_title: Would've made a better film if it were R rated.
reviews.content: Lots of scenes throughout the movie would've benefited from from an R rating. You could tell there's a lot of violent stuff happening but a lot of it is off screen. Whether it was the director or the studios decision to make it PG-13 kinda neuters most of the movie. It's unfortunate because it could've crossed over to the slasher genre.It's a decent story and the characters were ok. There's a few spots where it's genuinely creepy and eerie. There's also a slight little twist toward the end which I didn't see coming which was pretty neat.Overall the movie is ok. I'm not sure if there's an unrated version available, since this was on Netflix it just had the pg13.And thanks to terrible critic reviews there will probably never be a sequel. Too bad since there's potential.

reviews.review_title: Screw the movie...legendary actresses in this????
reviews.content: I gotta say, I watch a ton of low budget horror/sci-fi. This is right up there with the best of them. How in the hell did they get Ms. Faye Dunaway and Carrie-Anne Moss in this???I can't imagine being in Chinatown, Matrix, Network ( one of my fave movies) and winding up in something like this...we must raise our standards of film and not let legends like this languish in horrible movies.p.s.I have never taken the time to write about things on IMDb but Ms. Moss and Dunaway are worth it.'Zilla

Did I mention horrible? I kept watching to see if it would get better - but it just didn't - at all! The lack of story-line was a joke at best - seriously. There was no character building. It was this "creature" from - hell? mars? another dimension? that shows up for some unexplained reason when you say, "Bye Bye Man". A guy goes crazy and kills everyone in the beginning of the movie because they told other people about this unexplained "thing" - yes my vagueness is about as understandable as the movie "plot". Most movies - even horror movies - have a story-line. The villain/ghost/monster has a back story - a reason for being there. This was just a creepy looking Voldemort wanna be guy - who apparently also likes to stand weirdly in corners and look at people. Seriously - just don't - waste - your - time! I know you probably will anyway because curiosity gets the better of us - but your time would be better spent eating nails -- yes - it's that bad!

reviews.review_title: Solid horror film. Don't believe the hate.
reviews.content: Not sure why this has such a low rating but then something like The Shallow or Lights Out get 7s (at least last time I checked). Neither of those movies were scary. I put this on a similar level as It Follows. It's not as cool and stylish, but it's just as creepy and scary, if not more so. This movie left me very tense most of the way through (the 3rd act always slows down a bit). It's very creepy and eerie. Most people's complaints were pertaining to a lack of backstory on the Bye Bye Man. This is an unfortunate side effect of being raised in the millennial generation and the newest generation. Everything needs to be explained and handed on a silver platter. Some of the scariest, creepiest things are often left unknown. It's the unknown that is scary/interesting. It's with all horror movie franchises. They give more and more of the origin until everything is overexplained and dull. Michael Myers was scary because he went around killing people and we didn't know why. Then Rob Zombie goes and explains how it all came to be and ruins it. Was his version scary? A big fat no. It makes me think of the episode of Doug where he can't finish watching a horror movie cause he gets too scared. It's this creature that you never see, only a shadow and you hear it. Finally he sees it and laughs at how ridiculous it is. The unknown is scary. See the movie for yourself. It's definitely not perfect but it's a good horror movie with some chills and a good creepy atmosphere.
Not a Last Jedi Blockbuster of course, but a Meme worthy cult movie. Stream this if you want some cheap thrills on a saturday night best viewed with a big crowd.

reviews.review_title: Poor acting, not well thought out story
reviews.content: After seeing the trailer, you could say I wasn't particularly interested in this movie. But, I wanted to see what it had to offer, if anything. Watching this wasn't like watching The Last Airbender, since I didn't have high expectations, and, after watching, I think my expectations might've been higher than they should've been. I really don't understand what people were thinking when making this movie. It's like watching a really strange dream with weird acting and dialogue, and no well thought out plot - a weird dream I would have, on rare occasions. The acting was straight up laughable - I couldn't understand any of the characters. It was so obvious the actors were reading off a script, and some of them didn't put any thought into it.The story, too, didn't have any thought put into it. There was no backstory for The Bye Bye Man. We're given an opening scene during the 1960's or so where a man asks others if they told anyone of "the name", which obviously refers to "The Bye Bye Man", and they said they shared it with others, which results in the man killing these people. The name is basically a virus, and in order to get rid of it is to commit suicide or homicide. This is the only 'backstory' given to us.I recommend maybe watching this on Netflix(if it gets released on there) or on other streaming services. I wouldn't waste money on this; you'll be begging for your money back.

reviews.review_title: Not bad but not great either
reviews.content: This movie is getting so many mixed reviews, its honestly not terrible.The acting it not the greatest but there was a couple of jump scares and i found the plot interesting enough to want to watch it until the end. The story isn't completely original feeling like its taken plot lines from A nightmare on Elm street, The Ring, Insidious and It Follows, but it still holds enough weight to be its own movie (just). I don't recommend getting too excited to see this but its worth grabbing some popcorn, getting comfy on the couch and chilling out for the 90 min running time. I was giving it a 4 due to some minor plot holes, kinda crappy special effects and lack of back story into the "boogeyman's" origins but bumped it up to a 5 due to the fact that it has cameo's from Faye Dunaway, Leigh Whannell and Carrie-Anne Moss.

Yeah, it's not the perfect horror movie, but it just rubbed me the right way.The horror doesn't rely on constant, never ending "scare jumps", but rather on the suspense. Once they imbued the idea that the "bye bye man" can appear any time, anywhere, they really mess with the viewer mind. They force us into constant alert, into suspense. A fear that goes on and on and on.Also, a plus, is that instead of making everything incoherent and shaking and annoyingly dark, we can actually see what's going on. It's a fault that made me drop tons of horror movies- a fault this movie DIDNT make. Yeah, the acting isn't perfect, but it's far less than bad.
Yeah, the plot isn't mind boggling nor amazing, but it's far less than bad.Also a plus, I really loved how they tried to mingle with a bit of philosophy there. In the library scene. "If we erase any evidence, it's like it never existed.". Someone there read 1984 (; Anyways, I recommend it. It's a gem in my opinion. I would love a sequel with a bit more of a lore about the "bye bye man".
I don't know why people hate it, it's actually fun and different to other horror films

reviews.review_title: A Great Horror Movie To Watch With Friends Or Family
reviews.content: I immediately have to say that the beginning was dumb. Yes the actions that take place get explained but the execution was terrible when logic, as well as common knowledge of how sound works, is applied. Aside from that rough start this movie rocked. It had a good atmosphere and tension, the pacing was smooth and the story was very interesting with some good twist. I love how the ending is set up for a sequel but I personally can't imagine what they'd do for a second movie except for a retelling of the story with different deaths. Douglas Smith rocked his role as Elliot. Of course everyone was awesome but with Douglas Smith being the lead role he had more screen time and in return, majority of the audience attention. I will say that Ava Penner was hot as Anna. Over all this movie rocked and I needed something like this. I've been burned out on reviewing movies but this reignited my drive for getting them done.

I found the story itself quite reasonable for this type of genre. However, this film had the potential to employ its ideas to something a lot more original. The Bye Bye man could have focused more on the antagonist and given much more life to the myth. This just might have put that little bit of edge on the film, which is so desperately needed.The good news is that the film doesn't lag like a lot of horror films when they have to drag out the suspense or heavily build up the character development.There are quite a few cliché moments in the film. And many moments make you cringe out of the sheer stupidity of the characters. A girl runs in front of an oncoming train as if she is completely oblivious to the sirens, flashing lights, and her general well-being. A woman stands in the middle of the road in the dead of night as if she is also oblivious to any oncoming traffic and gets run over by a car. You get my point.I'll be straight out honest, and say the prologue could have been done much, much better. If you think the opening will grip you and pull you into the story then you are wrong. It's a bit corny, and not the least bit absorbing. I felt that it was funny rather than its intention of being serious or shocking.The Bye Bye Man (Doug Jones) was a sinister-looking character and I just wish they did more with him. I wanted to know more about his origins and just think that he should have been utilized a whole lot better. His hound, however, was so blatantly CGI that it was not nearly as effective or intimidating.The séance in the film was completely random and not needed. The coins were a nice touch but had very little connection to the Bye Bye man other than you are meant to be aware that he is near or coming for you.People who have either said his name, hear his name, or even thought about him are vulnerable to having vivid, troublesome hallucinations. It seems the Bye Bye man doesn't actually kill anyone physically but instead gets into people's minds to make them commit these horrendous acts.The acting was fairly below average. I would say except for Elliot (Douglas Smith) who was the only one I felt had somewhat of a decent, or interesting personality.The Bye Bye man won't go down to win any awards. It's fun enough for a bit of laughter and light-hearted entertainment. But it's not scary and it is very predictable. There was one little twist near the end which was quite unexpected but you don't care enough for it to impact you. While the ending of the film itself was just bland and insipid.5/10.

Half the positive reviews are fake, you can tell because they dont review any other movie and havent existed longer than this movie hasi didnt bother watching til the enda basic rule when making a horror movie is dont have characters make unrealistic decisions, or do things the audience wouldnt do. its frustrating to watch and doesnt honor the concept of what a horror movie is. terrible acting, terrible cgi, no plot, no character developmentan interesting concept done wrong, with an interesting cast misused
except for the girlfriend, she should keep her day job, this aint working outa whole lot of issues with this movie and some of the issues start with very small things, including the dumb robe on the wall, he is a grown man, you can just take the robe off the wall and cut this issue in half.

The Bye Bye Man this movie tries it's best to deliver itself to the viewer and yes it does it, if you have seen too much of Horror movies you can find the idea of the movie as unoriginal, it's not too creepy but it's your typical Horror movie, i found some ideas in the movie that was good and worth it, the ending was delivered well done too you might find it surprising, recommended if you are looking for a short and enjoyable ride, 6.5/10⭐

How the duck this damn librarian end up in the middle of the road in the middle of nowhere... with a dcking knife ffs.
guess its just one of those mystery never solve.
If ir had been marketed as an horror comedy I'd have given it a 10/10... specially after the scenes in the library and of him singing in the car...it was supposedly a serious horror movie though.

I'm a avid horror fan and anybody that's a fan of the horror genre will know that we have to trawl through at least 10-15 films before we find one we actually enjoy. I didn't have any expectations of 'The Bye Bye Man' and expected it to be another one I'd add to the average and forgettable, or damn right awful, pile, but I really enjoyed it.The concept of 'The Bye Bye Man' is interesting, the atmosphere is eerie and suspenseful, the plot is engaging throughout and there's multiple decent jump scares. How the Bye Bye Man is incorporated into the story means you never quite know what's real and what's not, which builds the suspense a lot.I've seen another reviewers make comparisons to 'A Nightmare on Elm Street' and 'It Follows' and I have to agree. The concept of The Bye Bye Man is similar to the entity in 'It Follows' and the idea that there's an evil that attaches itself to you and is devoted to killing you mirrors both 'It Follows' and 'A Nightmare on Elm Street'. Despite sharing similarities with other films in the genre, it's quite an original concept and isn't your typical slasher horror nor your typical supernatural horror.The only element of the film that lets it down is the acting. It's not terrible, but it's definitely not good either. I'd describe it as mediocre. This means that the characters themselves feel very one-dimensional and lack in any real personality, but that's a common trait of a lot of horrors, and it's not so bad that it ruins the enjoyment of the film.Overall, 'The Bye Bye Man' is an enjoyable viewing experience and definitely worth more than a 4 star rating. With a different cast I believe it could've been as popular and well-received as 'It Follows' (personally, I prefer 'The Bye Bye Man' to 'It Follows') because it has all of the other elements there to be a horror classic. My advice would be don't be deterred from watching based on the bad reviews and ratings, because they're misleading. On the same token, don't go in with high expectations, just enjoy it for what it is.

This movie is not perfect and is by far not the best I've seen in recent years. Nevertheless, I do not understand all the hate for this film. What I do understand is all the hate keeping others from watching it. It did for me
I just finished watching this now, despite the fact that I usually don't let the bad reviews keep me from watching a film. However, it was hard to find good public reviews for this movie but I kept scrolling and found some that made me give it a chance. For it's short run time I believe the story was relatively captivating. I even jolted once. I do wish it was longer for so more plot development but other than that it was a good watch. Like I always say, Just see it for yourself and decide for yourself.

"Don't Think It, Don't Say It" Well I'm Thinking It And I'm Putting It In Print So I'm Saying It Yadigg...It's a Whole LOT Better Than Some Of Those Other "Man" Movies I Have Seen...Then I Like The Title "The Bye Bye Man"

I can appreciate a tacky and overall not-scary film when it's interesting, but I had my (surprisingly high) hopes crushed for this one not long after starting. The opening scene was interesting and intense, but everything after that felt under-acted and forced. The Bye Bye Man himself has some interesting shots, but as a whole isn't a unique monster. The hallucinations weren't especially clever either until the ending, and as a whole I couldn't recommend this movie. The flashback scenes however are pretty dang good!

I had low expectations for this film, being a PG-13 horror film called The Bye Bye Man and all. But even I was surprised at how bad this was. It's almost seems like a parody of these wussy PG-13 money-grubbing horror movies that have been released in the last few years, but sadly it takes itself way to seriously to be a parody.The acting is absolutely terrible from all the main characters and it's actually pretty hilarious at some points. The effects are also just as bad, seriously the dog looks like it belongs in the first Resident Evil game, and the main villain isn't intimidating at all. And as usual in horror films, the teens are all complete idiots that constantly do stupid things to move the plot forward. Like why would you put a hammer that you're going to use to kill someone in plain view of said person WITH FREAKING BLOOD STILL ON IT!!??! The scares were all extremely predictable and cheap jump scares that aren't even scary because the The Bye Bye Man looks like he belongs in a retirement home.It's obvious this movie got a lot cut from it when it was downgraded to PG-13. The movie constantly brings up trains in relation to the villain but never explains its significance. Not to mention the three random naked people on the train tracks that aren't ever mentioned again. But anyway this movie is a passable piece of garbage that isn't scary in the slightest, do yourself a favor and save that hard earned cash for something actually good. Hopefully once the studios realize these PG-13 crapfests don't sell, we'll get some quality R horror films to replace this trash.
It was alright, the bye bye man lore may not exist in real life as far as I know but as far as the way they are messed with in the movie, it is an okay horror film.

This was a ridiculous attempt at a horror movie. NEVER make another movie again. I can not believe that you actually made a profit from this garbage, which is very unfortunate because it will only make you believe you should make another. But then again if you do you will probably lose money so go ahead, waist your money.

reviews.review_title: Expect very little and you'll enjoy it!
reviews.content: This was a weird one. As a lot of other reviews point out, the acting was so god awful that, at times, you wonder if it's intended (Lucien Laviscount is by far the worst, I can't shake the feeling that this guy is a complete tool in real life). The first weird part is that among all this abhorrent work, Douglas Smith actually does a really good job! The other weird part is how the script continually goes from mind blowing stupidity, to way above average in seconds. Sometimes you want more, some times you just wanna turn it off. Also, often times, movies like this start off great or at least okay, and then just nosedive around the 45-minute mark. This one does the opposite, it starts off absolutely terrible and then gets better and better, albeit somewhat schizophrenically, with every passing minute.So yeah, don't expect a masterpiece, don't even expect a good horror film, expect the kind of film you would have loved if you saw it as a 13 year old with your best friend Saturday night in your parents basement, and you will be decently entertained as an adult.

The film isn't really entertaining or scary. There is no suspense to it whatsoever. The antagonist is truly laughable and looks like something out of power rangers. The acting of two of the lead characters is truly awful, the girl and her boyfriend are just really bad actors who can't lead a conga line let alone a film. Lucien Laviscount puts in a good performance. The only one in the film mind. The concept could have been great but bad acting and story means you should really miss it.

reviews.review_title: Bye Bye Man, Bye Bye Money
reviews.content: I'm a lover of gore, horror, thriller, suspense type of movies. This? Is nothing. I feel bad. I'm writing my first review and it's because the movie is horrible. But I feel I must warn you.3 students rent a house away from campus and accidentally unleashes the demon within. And if you hear a coin drop that means he's coming and if the ghoulish dog appears, you're dead.Concept-wise, it's unique. I have to give them that. But there are a lot of things that doesn't make sense. Or at least they tried to put it there just so it appears to have a story or scary scene.The actor who played Eliot saved the film through his acting. And Lucien as John is an eye-candy. Other than that, it can't be saved. Even Matrix's Carrie-Anne Moss and Faye Dunaway fell flat.Don't waste your time. Read a book. Any book. Or magazine. Even the TV guide.
This film starts a bit slow but I got pleasant surprise just how funny it was really enjoyed it. Trinity is in it too. Give it a try.

Where do I even start with this garbage?This movie is all over the place. It's almost as if the writer himself was possessed into making this shitty film. The writing is easily the worst part of this film for me. They basically had an OK concept, then proceeded to write characters who are nothing more than stupid unlikable teenagers who constantly make bad and illogical decisions throughout the course of the film. Not only that, but they never even explain the origins of the Bye Bye Man, or how he works exactly or why he has this EXTREMELY poorly done CGI dog with him at all times. The acting is just awful (although I can't exactly blame them for the writer's mistakes) it pretty much consists of roles ranging from dumb teenagers to a bunch of b-side characters who don't even belong in the film or have any affect on the plot really.The only redeeming qualities I guess would be that the concept is somewhat interesting (if it were actually explained properly), and it is yet another unintentionally hilarious horror film.2/10
One of the worst films i've ever seen and some truly horrible acting

reviews.review_title: Don't Think It, Don't Pay for it
reviews.content: It could have really been something special.The legend alone is terrifying. Kept me awake for hours and took me forever to get his name out of my head.Yes this movie was awful because they introduced too many details to a very simple, yet creepy story. WHY!? Because they want a B horror movie for some reason. Sadly, this is a D horror movie.The only problem is they never explained this other features....? Like why introduce them? Doesn't make sense. Just none of it made sense. The casting was off minus Doug Jones. He looked great and that was it. Some of the worst CGI work with his unexplained dog. The only redeeming part was the end and The Bye Bye Man himself.Long story: Could have been great, but was awful and that's from someone who enjoys awful.

reviews.review_title: Not quite so bad it's good
reviews.content: I should give this movie a 2, its absolutely laughably terrible, but it dabbles in so bad its good territory. For example I think Wish Upon is a classic for how SO BAD ITS GOOD that horror movie attempt was. This isn't nearly as funny but it has its moments. Watch it buzzed with buddies, not to get scared.

This is my second attempt at watching this movie. The first time I tried it was a while back and I don't even remember it. It didn't hit me until about 15 minutes into the movie that I had already tried watching it. Well, the second time it was just as forgettable.Basically, everything every other review has said is true. It's boring, no storyline. Who is the BYE BYE MAN?I'm pretty lenient when it comes to bad movies but this time, I'm not happy about my time wasted.I always end up feeling sorry for the people involved in making bad movies. Do they know they're making a bad movie? Are they okay with it?3 stars for the attempt and decent looking cast. It's always worse when the people just look like your average Walmart shoppers.This is one of those movies to just skip. Just trust the reviews this time.

One of the worst movies to ever grace the screen of a movie theater. The acting is awful, the script is disgraceful, the directing is terrible. It is as if the writers took a list of horror clichés and just slammed them in randomly.The best thing about this movie is that SOMEONE PITCHED THIS TO A STUDIO AND CONVINCED THEM TO MAKE THIS

The bedside table was by far the best character. Even if the acting wasn't horrible, the story itself isn't scary. There wasn't one scene that delivered any element of fear. The roommate and the girlfriend were such poorly written/badly acted characters that i wanted to turn off the movie anytime they were on screen.

The Bye Bye Man is quite possibly one of the stupidest horror movies I've ever seen. Everything about it is just plain bad, from the acting, to the plot, to the effects, and especially the scariness. But what truly launches it into so-bad-it's-good territory is how weirdly pretentious it all is.Here are a few standout scenes that really showcase the awfulness of this movie.One of the first scenes in the film is of our incredibly boring main character, Elliot, discovering the words "don't think it, don't say it" carved onto a nightstand. When he turns it over, he sees the name of the titular villain. Now, one of the most important plot points in the movie is that after reporting on a case of a teenager killing his family (allegedly because the Bye Bye Man told him to do so), the previous owner of the protagonist's house did everything in his power to erase the Bye Bye Man from existence. He literally committed mass murder on a bunch of his neighbors just for this purpose. But, apparently, he was so lazy he couldn't even be bothered to check around his house to see if he left the name anywhere. Honestly, it's all so entirely contrived that it is quite hilarious.Later, Elliot investigates the Bye Bye Man further, and eventually comes upon a dossier about him in his local library. Again, I must point out how incredibly, impossibly stupid this reporter was. Honestly, you didn't even bother to get rid of all copies of your article before going on a bloody rampage? Really?And we come to one of the final scenes in the movie, which is also hands down the most ridiculous. As you might expect, the Bye Bye Man comes to kill Elliot, but just before he does so, Elliot proclaims his love for the Bye Bye Man. I mean, do I even need to explain the problem with this? The film has suffocated itself with its own self-importance so much, that it barely makes sense anymore. Forget Elliot; the film itself has lost its mind.Oh, but that's not the end of the stupidity, as the film manages to pack in one final, dumb punch. Basically, the house is burned to the ground, but one of Elliot's roommates who was witness to a bunch of Bye Bye Man stuff lives. As he's being taken out of the building on a stretcher, the investigator working on the case asks him the name of the person that caused all of this. And the roommate just... tells her. Again, the dumbness of this should speak for itself, but I'll spell it out anyway. Despite all the murders he's witnessed, the chaos he's endured, the madness he's experienced, he still gives up the name to the investigator for literally no reason. What's the matter with these people? Erasing a name from existence in the laziest way possible? Falling in love with a supernatural murderer? Purposefully condemning at least one more person to death for no reason?The Bye Bye Man is a stain on the careers of all involved. I don't know how Trinity from the Matrix and Faye Dunaway got roped into this catastrophe, but they certainly couldn't have appeared in anything worse than this. Unless you're looking for a hilarious comedy, avoid this film.Final Score: 20/100.

reviews.review_title: My farts are scarier than this movie
reviews.content: This was more of a cringe comedy than a horror film. There was no emotion, you don't get attached to the characters, the acting was .. I don't even know. I laughed more than anything and cringed so hard I basically imploded.

This movie is the perfect example of how to not make a horror film with a killer who makes no sense and doesn't even have an origin he's just there, also with really bad acting.The purpose of the "bye bye man" is for people to spread his name so he can become more known and have more victims but that makes no sense because he has to kill those same people that are getting his name more known which is pretty ridiculous. now some of the scenes well i should so most are so stupid, their is literally a part in the movie where kim is explaining that the bye bye man has the power to make people see illusions a couple second later kim and elliot are riding down the rode she see's people struggling to get off the train tracks kim jumps out the car and tries to help those people while elliot is screaming at her that it's not real even after the five minutes of explaining that the bye bye man makes others see illusions as the train is coming.

reviews.review_title: Decent idea destroyed by bad acting
reviews.content: I think the story and idea for this film wasn't too bad. A lot of clichés...but I think a new "evil" villain was created that was ominous and original. However the script and film loses credibility when the acting is so bad. I'm not sure whether it was the direction, editing or the actors...but I found that to be the worst part. Even cameo's by Carrie Ann Moss and the legendary Faye Dunaway couldn't save this. I found the worse culprit to be the girl. I felt like I was watching Nightmare on Elm Street with the forced acting of Heather Langenkamp. Or even Adrienne King from the original Friday the 13th. Where it was tolerable then...we've advanced so much in cinema we expect better acting nowadays.I never like films that are set up for a sequel...so the end I rolled my eyes. Wasn't really necessary. I think the script jumped a bit and wasn't as smooth as it could be...but overall it was ok. But its always hard to get past bad acting.

Bye Bye man more like the Why Why would I go and see this film man. I'm a huge fan of horror films I love films such as The forest, Ghostbusters (the new one of course!) and Johnny English. I was persuaded to go to this film by my friend Doug however after watching this film we are no longer friends. I had also only read 1 review for the Bye Bye man on IMDb and it praised the directing of the film, the only possible explanation is that this review was written by the director as this is a dreadful film. The acting in the film was under par and by under par I mean the worst acting I have ever seen in my whole entire life. Did I get spooked I hear you ask? The answer is not even a little spooked. I was going to give this film a 0 out of 10 however that is impossible so I gave it a 3 as I would like to see a sequel!

All the rest of the aspects of the film are yawning, holes dug into land unfortunately. There is nothing new in Bye Bye Man. Nothing surprising. Nothing extreme. Nothing frightening. He does not have a stroke disregarding the impetus of the beginner scene for the film, the early disguised as the teen character a company is able to squeeze out any kind of stranger sympathy or compassion from the spectator.

Watching this drivel, I thought of my experience and how it is like if you told a first year film student to make a film inspired by 'Nightmare on Elm Street'. This is so all over the place in terms of the rules, when the villain shows up and is it him doing it, are they just a bit paranoid and it's not really the BB man. There is no consistency and presence and compellingness to the villain . Its so bland and vague and messy in its design and most of the acting is pretty terrible. I cant count the amount of times I laughed, so that s a plus at least, I got that out of this film, but I was definitely not scared.With Nightmare on Elm St. You can experience who Freddy is, what he does and how he terrorises these kids life in a consistent and visceral way that makes you scared for the characters to go to sleep, he has so many tricks up his sleeve to mess with the kids, we've all experienced messed up nighmares and felt the potential of being harmed, and that film does a great job of heightening that experience. Here, with this film, it's not set up well at all how this Bye Bye man works and you get no sense of what he does, sooooo inconsistent and just got bored and laughed at these hullucinations, they had zero impact on me. Sorry, Filmmakers, next time, think about strong setup and rules.

reviews.review_title: Don't think it, don't say it- You just hate Netflix
reviews.content: There's a crazy, irrational hate against Netflix movies. I guess it's trendy.I'm not saying that all Netflix movies are great, not at all. But I dare you to tell me the name of a single TV channel/streaming platform/production company that makes gold all the time.This movie in particular is not a bad movie- it's actually a pretty good one. It reminds me of It Follows, only with a B-movie feel, without all the hipster/millennial crap and with a waaaaay better script.For those of you that like good horror movies, please don't skip this one because of the negative reviews and those hilarious rates: it's probably worth your time.

Without going into it so deeply, I actually liked this movie. Perhaps the main thing I hated was the CGI dog. Other than that a good movie. I was going to submit a small paragraph expressing my liking for this movie, so now i'm just typing extra words until I reach 150 characters. Anyone reading this, Email me at Nickeyblack35@gmail to discuss the film.

This film has an interesting concept and narrative however there's this constant feeling that i'm missing something which is probably caused by how disjointed this film is, with sequences sometimes too short/too long or just out of place. One of my biggest peeves is some of the acting, especially by the lead female, which ruins the immersion in certain scenes especially since the rest of the cast are pretty talented and fun to watch.Another quick thing is the music at the climax just didn't belong, whilst nice it was in the wrong genre, suiting an action adventure film rather than this horror production.Though overall it wasn't the worst i don't think i would watch it again.

The concept of this story is actually scary as hell, but unfortunately it falls flat due to underwhelming depth and lack of backstory. It just references a myth, but it never explains the origin of said myth: who is the Bye Bye Man? What is his beef with (these) people? What's with the dog? What's with the trains? It does not go beyond "A guy that murders people that say his name, and his pet (and there are also trains I guess)", which in turn makes it generic. This is probably the result of poor story conversion, as there is an actual backstory that would have made this so much more gruesome than it was.It also lacks interesting characters, and to an extent a good cast. Doug Jones was amazing as the titular character, I'll give them that. Virgil and Hat Girl were OK. Elliot wasn't awful; properly scared, and it was definitely a step up from Smith's role in Ouija. But the rest did not deliver. In particular Sasha was played by someone who is obviously a model and not really an actor.Furthermore, it suffered from pretty poor editing; a lot of scenes ended abruptly, even when they show something that gets referenced later, which makes you lose focus and as a result confuses you. The main plotline has quite some holes and situations that simply make no sense, even if you caught all the important details.On a positive note, it was quite entertaining, be it more in a fun way than in an actual scary way. It is not the worst thing to watch, but just had too much potential wasted to be actually good.Rating: 4.5/10.

More background noise than anything. Decent enough plot executed poorly. How did Moss end up here? They botoxed Dunaway so much I almost didn't recognize her. I don't know why Hollywood insists on unrealistic beauty standards? It's ok to look your age. Cressida Bonas was terrible. So whiney, she's a terrible actress, it's almost comical. And why would you bring your little girl to your mentally unstable brothers house?!!? Shes trying to push her way in the house and hes got blood all over him? Dumb.

The budget was $7.4 million and they could make a descent horror movie? How could the cg pet be so awful? This movie isn't even isn't even in the so bad that it's funny.It's based on a chapter of "The Bridge to Body Island" of Robert Damon Schneck's book The President's Vampire. It's supposedly non-fiction.I can't help by consider how many amazing horror movies out there that are not as mainstream as this movie with a much small budget.If you want to spread the word, then why not keep people alive and slowly torment them? It doesn't make any sense. There are too many plot holes. There aren't even enough cheap jump scares.It's not even a gorefest. I'm not sure what the movie has going for it. I hope there isn't a sequel. I don't understand how it was so mainstream and had such a budget.

reviews.review_title: Watched it once, shame on me, watched it twice, ugh shame on me again!
reviews.content: I feel like this movie really fits the cliche of terrible horror movies that tend to float around. Let me paint a picture here, myself and my then boyfriend relaxing and watching Netflix one friday evening, looking for something a little spooky (as we are both into horror movies), let's just say we spent more time laughing at this movie and pointing out the cliches than being scared.

The movie begins strong and was legitimately creepy, but once the weirdness kicks in it starts to fall apart.The biggest problem with The Bye Bye Man (besides the absurd title) are the uneven performances from Douglas Smith and Cressida Bonas. While Smith is somewhat reliable in this role but he delves into hammy waters often enough that it becomes hard to take him seriously. Bonas, on the other hand, is almost never believable and her delivery is almost universally terrible. It makes me wonder how a director can watch a performance as bad as hers and consider it to be acceptable.This is particularly jarring when compared to the performances of Lucien Laviscount and Jenna Kanell. Kanell's part is comparatively smaller than Bonas's, but the quality of her acting is so markedly better that one cannot help bu think their roles should have been switched. Laviscount seems to be a reliably effective actor, conveying genuine emotions where Smith is more hit or miss. The discrepancy between the male actors is not quite as pronounced,, however.The movie also should have been a bit longer. They characters seem to jump to conclusions not based on their experience within the film, but rather because the plot demands it. Better writing would have helped as well.In the end we have a mediocre horror film that occasionally shows what could have been if only a few small changes had been made.

I feel the negative reviews are a bit harsh here. Honestly, as far as cheap horror flicks go, this one is pretty decent. The story and plot elements had a lot of good potential, and there were genuinely good plot twists near the end. And kudos for not making the title character just a cheap cgi monster, and we instead get a nice makeup job. Certainly not the scariest of boogeymen, but definitely unique. The flaws mostly exist in the characters and performances, particularly the lead actress, who does her best I'm sure, but just doesn't quite sell it. The way the characters are portrayed and the cheesy dialogue is at times impossible to get behind, but this is to be expected in a movie like this. No, this isn't a major horror masterpiece. It's a decent thriller that makes an excellent time killer. Just go with it, and enjoy the ride. You could do so much worse than The Bye Bye Man-- Wes Wall.

reviews.review_title: I was laughing all the way through
reviews.content: I enjoy watching terrible movies from time to time and I knew this had the potential to be brilliantly terrible, boy did it deliver.After the film credits came up and I saw the director's name was Stacy Title, I laughed harder then I think I've ever laughed in my entire life,because I thought Stacy Title was the new Alan Smithee (a name used by directors who want to disown their movie, which has recently been used less and less ever since the general audience figured out directors were doing this) when I went home to see what other movies had been released under the name of Stacy Title I realized Stacy Title is a real person and I laughed even harder than I did before.It failed at being scary to the point of being hilarious and the acting was even worse.I would give this Movie a higher score but I don't want people think this movie is genuinely good.

I thought that this movie was good and creepy also it did make me jump numerous times. I did however think there was nothing really answered about the Bye Bye Man and this did end up with me having too many questions which I hope that they make a second movie for which answers these.

Apart from the intro it feels like I have seen every scene before. The story is built entirely around the most commonly used horror movie tropes, without adding anything unique.Another problem is that the descent into madness happens so quickly that it feels more humorous than scary.A totally expendable title.

I know this is a horror movie, therefore they always rate low. But... I don't see how this movie rates THIS LOW.
I have seen some reviews by "professionals" who seem to think this movie is badly directed and paced. That is rubbish. The movie ticks along at a good speed, and I was entertained for the full 96 minutes.
I will say the acting was only average in some parts ( I'm looking at you Cressida Bonas. Carrie Ann Moss also seemed a bit disinterested)
At the end of the day though, the movie was much better than all of that other supernatural dribble that has flooded the market in recent years...One last thing that needs a mention is that it seemed to be sanitized a bit to get a pg13 rating, which hurt it a little but didn't ruin it as some have suggested. All in all, it's worth a look. You could do a LOT worse..

Gory things happen but you see no gore... The plot "twists" are so obvious. The seeing things just isn't well written or done enough. If this had a better writer it would have been a much better film.

I think The Bye Bye Man is a very competent film that unfortunately has bad writing I like jump scares and the effects and performances but the story was choppy and the characters are as stale as my milk in real life I think this is 1/10 horrible but because I'm a joke account I think it's 4/10 worthy because Metacritic says so and I don't wanna form my own opinion that takes guts and I have no guts also The Last Jedi was amazing even if it was kinda mediocore I hope you all have a good day okay byeeeeeeePS Predator sucks

Finally a movie about some mysterious monster that isn't just a hallucination! Was getting sick of all the "creepy crawlies are coming, they*re coming, they're HERE! ...but don't worry it was just a dream of our protagonist...".Acting is spot on for this genre, not Oscar-worthy, but downright Cringe-worthy at times. Plot is simple, yet some things have been left vague. I'm guessing it's due to budget restraints or because the team behind this was afraid that audience wouldn't appreciate detailed backstory to the creature. In all honesty, leaving it up to thin air made the movie creepier for me, since the monster lacked the fear factory in appearance. It was just plain weird.I wasn't aware that there was a real legend behind this before I came to IMDB. Had the team written it in, I think it would have made the creature too much human.With all the flaws in it the movie managed to entertain me, even puzzle me momentarily, and as a fan of 80's slashers I would recommend this to anybody who's still watching Freddy, Jason and Michael butchering teenagers. Obviously this is not on the same level as them, but pretty darn close.
Again don't believe the bad reviews. Some people can not see quality, and most of the time is it because they are to young to no better. It made my hair rise on my arm. That's the type i like.

This is the culmination of the last few years of sanitized pg-13 wanna be horror trash that studios have been pumping out lately. Stupid story, bad acting, incredibly dumb name for the villain... I could go on and on but honestly it's not worth it. If you give this movie anything above a 5 you're taste in movies is terrible. Maybe even as terrible as this awful movie.oh, and here's the spoiler, it SUCKS.
Sure, the acting in some places are not great, but looking past those small specs on the lens, you've got a decent movie.

reviews.review_title: This movie is just bad but there is some fun to be had
reviews.content: The acting is bad, but with such a horrible screenplay I can't be surprised. The editing is horrendous as people will just teleport from one room on the second floor to suddenly being in the kitchen or will teleport from outside to coming down the stairs inside the house to the first floor. This movie is a farce for all the wrong reasons. BUT to give credit where it's due, this movie is a great fun movie to put on at a party and enjoy like The Room where you just rip into it. If I'm being serious, I give this movie a 2/10 for just all around poor everything. But on the fun scale, this movie gets a solid 7/10. It's a great "watch with friends while drinking" movie that I recommend solely for that reason alone.
This was a chore to gwt through at some points, but overall its nothing special, the acting was sub par at best, and the FX were halloween-esque.

College teen horror movie crap festI've heard the original story, and it is a lot better. When I first heard they were making a movie about it, I was like "how?"Now this isn't just a case of a movie that doesn't stand up to the original story, it just doesn't stand up at all. Couldn't get past half way through it

reviews.review_title: Great movie - like others not sure why scores are so low
reviews.content: I watched on Netflix as part of my subscription.It's a really good flick. Acting was good, plot good, the minor amount of CGI not great, but we're talking 3 odd seconds in the entire movie for that comment.One of my favourite movies happens to be 'They' 2002. Watch that movie which scored a dire 4.8. I'd give that movie an 8, easy. Make ur own opinion.Like others, I'd have missed this little gem, had I have followed the low IMDB score.I appreciate the irony in when I say 'don't trust IMDB' ratings. I'm learning that IMDB reviews and said production of movies are having to grease palms. My view anyway.We are all familiar with 'pay per view' are we now in the realm of 'pay per review'?Great movie, watch it.

The reason I gave it below a 5 is because the main character knows what it is hut keeps falling into it's traps and believing these hallucinations. It's not a bad produced film, the story is messed up. Ok, now, they keep going on about the problem and I have no idea what the killer is. I'm at 1:35 minutes in. Ok the main character is obviously the un-castes role from Dumb and Dumber. Now the other characters are being told how stupid they are. OMG.
Very suspenseful and good storyline. Acting was good too..
